intro: Hieracium perfoliosum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are deeply lobed. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from June to September, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium perfoliosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
